properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heat event continues through the end of the week. Inland from the Great Lakes, daytime high temperatures near 30 degrees Celsius will accompany humidex values in the mid thirties through the next several days. Overnight low temperatures in the upper teens are also expected during this period. Please refer to your public forecast for further details on expected temperatures. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index approaching the high risk category. Never leave people or pets inside a parked vehicle. ### The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-09T18:28:26-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-09T02:29:26-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1781833975.2020
Area: Blind River - Thessalon, Espanola - Killarney, Manitoulin Island
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, damaging hail and heavy rain until this evening. Boaters may be surprised by strong wind gusts over bodies of water. ### Very large hail can damage property, break windows, dent vehicles and cause serious injury. Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-09T04:59:00-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-09T02:00:00-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4130467947.2020

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of hot weather is expected. Daytime high temperatures in the low thirties will continue through the end of the week. Overnight low temperatures near 18 degrees Celsius will provide little relief from the heat. Please refer to your public forecast for further details on expected temperatures. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index approaching the high risk category. ### The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of hot weather is expected. Daytime high temperatures near 30 degrees Celsius with humidex values in the mid to high thirties are forecast to begin tomorrow and last through Friday. Overnight low temperatures in the upper teens are also expected during this period, unlike tonight which will be a bit cooler. Please refer to your public forecast for further details on expected temperatures. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index approaching the high risk category. ### The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A band of heavy rain with embedded thundershowers has stalled over parts of the Annapolis, Kings and Hants counties and is producing locally very heavy rates of rainfall in excess of 15 mm per hour. This band of rain could linger for a few more hours before weakening and moving southward, and over these areas local amounts in excess of 50 mm are possible. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-09T10:13:03-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-09T03:15:03-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3517597135.2020
Area: Kings County, Annapolis County, Hants County

properties.Title: Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots are expected or occurring in the area. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 9:57 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. ### Heavy downpours are likely to cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-07-09T04:56:03-00:00

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The extreme heat wave continues A warm and humid air mass over Southern Quebec will continue over the next few days. Temperatures will exceed the 30-degree mark during the day and will not fall below 20 degrees at night. Combined temperature and humidity values will produce humidex values of 40. These conditions are expected to persist through Saturday. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-09T20:01:22-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-09T04:02:22-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1992368124.2020

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. Bands of heavy rain continue to circle around a disturbance over western Saskatchewan. Over the past 24 hours North Battleford has already seen approximately 150 mm of rain while other communities in the area have seen anywhere from 50 to 100 mm. The rain is expected to gradually taper off tonight but a further 10 to 30 mm may be possible before ending. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-09T14:08:10-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-09T01:35:10-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1579321332.2020
